alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued April 19 at 12:01AM HST until April 19 at 2:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM HST WEDNESDAY FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... At 1201 AM HST, Law Enforcement reported Highway 11 remains closed in the vicinity of Kawa Flats between mile marker 57 (Ninoole Loop) and mile marker 63 (Naalehu) due to water over the road. Additionally, Kalaiki Road was closed from Pahala to Naalehu due to flooding. Rain intensity has decreased slightly and is now falling at a rate of around 1 inch per hour. Flash flooding is ongoing and is expected to continue with additional showers developing and moving onshore from the south. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hawaiian Paradise Park, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Volcano, Glenwood, Mountain View, Wood Valley, Pahala, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidland Estates, Punaluu Beach, Pahoa, Kawa Flats, Naalehu, Fern Forest, Eden Roc, Fern Acres, Kalapana, Kurtistown and Ainaloa. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
